title: What's Cooking: Maine crab with avocado and grapefruit
text:
SOUTH BURLINGTON, Vt. - Chef Cody Vasek from Trapp Family Lodge joins us this morning with a delicious summer seafood appetizer!
Maine Crab with avocado and grapefruit
Citrus vinaigrette
Grapefruit juice-1/4 cup
1 tablespoon lemon juice
¼ cup olive oil
¼ cup of agave or honey
1 tablespoon fresh tyme chopped
Salt and white pepper to taste
Mix ingredients and place in container or squeeze bottle
For plate up- 1 avocado is 2 portions, 1 grapefruit is 4 portions
Cut the avocado in segments should be 8 segments per avocado
Cut segments for the grapefruit as well, set aside.
Fresh crab meat, preferably Maine crab, clean no shells, may need to pick through
To plate-
Place avocado on plate, dress the crab in a bowl with vinaigrette and salt and pepper. Place the crab meat on top of the segments of avocado. Place grapefruit segments around the crab and avocado. Garnish with sea salt and cilantro. Great summer dish for a starter, add mix greens or crackers. At the restaurant we use cumin tuiles, gives it texture and height, please enjoy!! Cheers
